references.reason: This paper is foundational for the concept of benign overfitting, which is central to the current paper's investigation of the same phenomenon in kernel ridge regression.

references.paper_title: Two models of double descent for weak features
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of double descent, a phenomenon also explored in relation to the overfitting behavior of the Gaussian kernel ridge regression.

references.paper_title: Surprises in high-dimensional ridgeless least squares interpolation
references.reason: This paper provides insights into the behavior of ridgeless regression in high dimensions, a topic directly relevant to the analysis of Gaussian kernel ridge regression.

references.paper_title: Generalization error of random feature and kernel methods: hypercontractivity and kernel matrix concentration
references.reason: This paper offers a theoretical framework for analyzing generalization error in kernel methods, providing essential tools for studying the overfitting behavior of Gaussian kernel ridge regression.

references.paper_title: An agnostic view on the cost of overfitting in (kernel) ridge regression
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the cost of overfitting in ridge regression, providing a relevant theoretical foundation for the study of overfitting in Gaussian kernel ridge regression.
